content.p: This title must be liberally construed so that a speedy settlement of estates is accomplished at the least expense to the parties.

section.heading: Construction of title: Title to be construed consistent withchapter 719of NRS.

content.p: Except as otherwise specifically provided in this title, the provisions of this title must be construed in a manner consistent with the provisions ofchapter 719of NRS.
As used in this title, unless the context otherwise requires, the words and terms defined inNRS 132.030to132.370, inclusive, have the meanings ascribed to them in those sections.
ï¿½Abatementï¿½ means a proportional reduction of a pecuniary devise when the money or other assets out of which the devise is payable are not sufficient to pay the devise in full.

ï¿½Acknowledgmentï¿½ means a declaration that an instrument has been executed for the purposes stated therein and, if the instrument was executed in a representative capacity, that the instrument was signed with proper authority and executed as the act of the person represented and identified therein.
ï¿½Administratorï¿½ means a person not designated in a will who is appointed by the court to administer an estate.

ï¿½Agentï¿½ means a person authorized to represent or act for another person, including an attorney-in-fact under a durable or nondurable power of attorney and a person authorized to make decisions concerning the health care of another person.
A trust, includes a person who has a present or future interest, vested or contingent, and the owner of an interest by assignment or other transfer; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An instrument designating a beneficiary, includes a beneficiary of any nonprobate transfer; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A beneficiary designated in a governing instrument, includes a grantee of a deed, a devisee, a beneficiary of a trust, a beneficiary under a designation, a donee, an appointee or a taker in default under a power of appointment, or a person in whose favor a power of attorney or a power held in any individual, fiduciary or representative capacity is exercised, ï¿½but does not include a person who receives less than $100 under a will.
ï¿½Certified paper originalï¿½ means a tangible document that contains the text of an electronic will and, if applicable, a self-proving affidavit concerning the electronic will.

ï¿½Childï¿½ includes a person entitled to take as a child by intestate succession from the parent whose relationship is involved and excludes a person who is a stepchild, a foster child, a grandchild or any more remote descendant.

ï¿½Citationï¿½ means a document issued by the clerk of the court, as authorized by statute or ordered by the court, requiring a person to appear, directing a person to act or conduct himself or herself in a specified way, or notifying a person of a hearing.
ï¿½Claim,ï¿½ in respect to the estate of a decedent, includes a liability of the decedent, whether arising in contract, in tort or otherwise, that arises before the death of the decedent.

ï¿½Codicilï¿½ means an addition to a will that may modify or revoke one or more provisions of the will, or add one or more provisions to the will, and is signed with the same formalities as a witnessed will, electronic will or holographic will.
ï¿½Community propertyï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 123.220.

section.heading: ï¿½Community property with right of survivorshipï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Community property with right of survivorshipï¿½ means community property in which a right of survivorship exists pursuant toNRS 111.064or115.060or any other provision of law.

ï¿½Descendantï¿½ includes descendants of all generations. For the purposes of this section, the relationship of parent and child at each generation is determined by the definitions of ï¿½childï¿½ and ï¿½parentï¿½ contained in this title.

ï¿½Designation of beneficiaryï¿½ means a governing instrument naming a beneficiary of an insurance policy or annuity, of an account designated as payable on death, of a security registered as transferable on death, or of a pension, profit-sharing, retirement or similar benefit plan or other nonprobate transfer.
ï¿½Devise,ï¿½ used as a noun, means a testamentary disposition of real or personal property and, used as a verb, means to dispose of real or personal property by will.

ï¿½Deviseeï¿½ means a person designated in a will to receive a devise. For the purposes ofchapters 133,134,135and148of NRS, in the case of a devise to an existing trust or trustee, or to a trustee of a trust described by will, the term means the trust or trustee, and not a beneficiary of the trust.

ï¿½Distributeeï¿½ means a person who has received property of a decedent from the decedentï¿½s personal representative other than as a creditor or purchaser. A testamentary trustee is a distributee only to the extent of distributed assets or increment thereto remaining in his or her hands. A beneficiary of a testamentary trust to whom the trustee has distributed property received from a personal representative is a distributee of the personal representative. As used in this section, ï¿½testamentary trusteeï¿½ includes a trustee to whom assets are transferred by will to the extent of the devised assets.
ï¿½District courtï¿½ or ï¿½courtï¿½ means a district court of this State sitting in probate or otherwise adjudicating matters pursuant to this title.
ï¿½Domestic partnersï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 122A.030.
ï¿½Electronic notary publicï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 240.186.
ï¿½Electronic recordï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 719.090.
ï¿½Electronic signatureï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 719.100.
ï¿½Electronic willï¿½ means a will that is created and maintained in an electronic record.
ï¿½Estateï¿½ includes the property of the decedent or trust whose affairs are subject to this title as it is originally constituted and as it exists from time to time during administration.
ï¿½Estate taxï¿½ means federal estate tax, including any interest and penalty thereon.
ï¿½Executorï¿½ means a person nominated in a will and appointed by the court to execute the provisions of the will and administer the estate of the decedent.

ï¿½Expenses of administrationï¿½ means funeral expenses and expenses actually and properly incurred by a personal representative in the administration of an estate, including, without limitation, expenses incurred for the maintenance or preservation of the assets of an estate, plus the fees of the personal representative, any attorney retained by the personal representative and any other consultant engaged by him or her.
ï¿½Family allowanceï¿½ means the money allocated from the estate by the court pursuant toNRS 146.030.
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Trust adviserï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 163.5545. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Trust protectorï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 163.5547.
ï¿½Foreign jurisdictionï¿½ means any jurisdiction other than this State.
ï¿½Giftï¿½ means a gratuitous transfer of property to a recipient for less than full market value.
An instrument creating or exercising a power of appointment or a power of attorney; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A dispositive, appointive or nominative instrument of any similar type.
ï¿½Guardianï¿½ means a person who has qualified as the guardian of a minor or incapacitated person pursuant to testamentary or judicial appointment, but does not include a guardian ad litem.
ï¿½Heirsï¿½ means persons, including the surviving spouse and the state, who are entitled by intestate succession to the property of a decedent.
ï¿½Holographic willï¿½ means a testamentary document that complies with the requirements ofNRS 133.090.

ï¿½Incapacitated personï¿½ means a person who is impaired by reason of mental illness, mental deficiency, advanced age, disease, weakness of mind or any other cause except minority, to the extent of lacking sufficient understanding or capacity to make or communicate responsible decisions.
The whole of any property, real or personal, legal or equitable, present or future, or any part thereof, or any other estate therein; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A power to appoint, consume, apply or expend property; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any other right, power, privilege or immunity relating to property.

ï¿½Interested personï¿½ means a person whose right or interest under an estate or trust may be materially affected by a decision of a fiduciary or a decision of the court. The fiduciary or court shall determine who is an interested person according to the particular purposes of, and matter involved in, a proceeding.
ï¿½Intestate,ï¿½ used as a noun, means a decedent who dies without leaving a will.
ï¿½Intestate estateï¿½ includes an estate where no will has been offered or admitted to probate as the last will and testament and an estate where the will does not distribute the entire estate.
ï¿½Inventoryï¿½ means the description of assets required byNRS 144.040.
ï¿½Issueï¿½ means children, grandchildren or more remote lineal descendants.

section.heading: ï¿½Joint tenants with right of survivorshipï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Joint tenants with right of survivorshipï¿½ includes co-owners of property held under circumstances that entitle one or more to the whole of the property on the death of the other or others.
ï¿½Leaseï¿½ includes an oil, gas or other mineral lease.
ï¿½Lettersï¿½ includes letters testamentary, letters of administration, letters of administration with will annexed and letters of special administration.
ï¿½Lienï¿½ means a charge upon property for the satisfaction of a debt, including an obligation not satisfied, a judgment, unpaid taxes and an unpaid obligation for materials or labor.
ï¿½Minorï¿½ means a person who is under 18 years of age.
ï¿½Mortgageï¿½ means a conveyance, agreement or arrangement in which property is encumbered or used as security.
ï¿½Nonprobate transferï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 111.721.
ï¿½Noticeï¿½ means information provided pursuant toNRS 155.010or155.020or any other statute requiring advance information of an opportunity, obligation or the occurrence of an event.
ï¿½Oathï¿½ means a form of attestation which affirms that the taker will faithfully perform the duties of a specified office.
ï¿½Orderï¿½ includes a declaration, decree or judgment by a court and is a final judgment for all purposes, including an appeal underNRS 155.190.

ï¿½Parentï¿½ includes any person entitled to take, or who would be entitled to take if the child died without a will, as a parent by intestate succession from the child whose relationship is in question and excludes any person who is a stepparent, foster parent or grandparent.
ï¿½Personï¿½ includes a natural person, organization, government or a governmental subdivision, agency or instrumentality.

ï¿½Personal representativeï¿½ includes an executor, an administrator, a successor personal representative, a special administrator and persons who perform substantially the same function under the law governing their status.
ï¿½Petitionï¿½ means a verified written request to the court for an order.

ï¿½Probate,ï¿½ used as a noun, means a legal proceeding in which the court has jurisdiction to administer, pay out and distribute the assets of a decedent to the persons entitled to them, including devisees, heirs, creditors and others.
ï¿½Probate homesteadï¿½ means a homestead that can be set apart by the court pursuant toNRS 146.020.
ï¿½Propertyï¿½ means anything that may be the subject of ownership, and includes both real and personal property and any interest therein.
ï¿½Qualified custodianï¿½ means a person who meets the requirements ofNRS 133.320.
ï¿½Recordï¿½ means information that is inscribed on a tangible medium, or that is stored in an electronic medium and is retrievable in perceivable form.

ï¿½Right of representationï¿½ means the method of distributing property by which, through inheritance or succession, the descendants of a deceased heir take the same share or right in the estate of another person that their parent or other ancestor would have taken if living. A posthumous child is deemed living at the death of his or her parent.

ï¿½Securityï¿½ includes any note, stock, treasury stock, bond, debenture, evidence of indebtedness, certificate of interest or participation in an oil, gas or mining title or lease or in payments out of production under such a title or lease, collateral trust certificate, transferable share, voting trust certificate or, in general, any interest or instrument commonly known as a security, or any certificate of interest or participation, any temporary or interim certificate, receipt or certificate of deposit for, or any warrant or right to subscribe to or purchase any of the foregoing.
ï¿½Separate propertyï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 123.130.
ï¿½Settlement,ï¿½ in reference to the estate of a decedent, includes administration, distribution and closing.
ï¿½Settlorï¿½ means the person who creates a trust, however described in the trust instrument.
ï¿½Special administratorï¿½ means a personal representative appointed pursuant tochapter 140of NRS.
ï¿½Spouseï¿½ includes a domestic partner as set forth inNRS 122A.200.

ï¿½Stateï¿½ means a state of the United States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the United States Virgin Islands, or any territory or insular possession subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
ï¿½Successor personal representativeï¿½ means a personal representative, other than a special administrator, who is appointed to succeed a previously appointed personal representative.
ï¿½Successorsï¿½ means persons, other than creditors, who are entitled to property of a decedent under the terms of the decedentï¿½s will or pursuant to this title.
ï¿½Taxï¿½ includes an income, property, excise, estate, gift or inheritance tax.
ï¿½Testamentary trustï¿½ means a trust created by the terms of the will of a person.
ï¿½Testate estateï¿½ means an estate with respect to which a will has been offered and admitted to probate.
ï¿½Testatorï¿½ means a person who makes a will.

ï¿½Trustï¿½ means an interest in property held by one person for the benefit of another, established by an instrument executed during the life of the settlor or by the settlorï¿½s will. The term includes an express trust, private or charitable, with additions thereto, wherever and however created. The term also includes a trust created or determined by judgment or decree under which the trust is to be administered in the manner of an express trust.
ï¿½Trusteeï¿½ includes an original, additional or successor trustee, whether or not appointed or confirmed by a court.
ï¿½Verificationï¿½ means a declaration that a statement is true, made under oath or affirmation under penalty of perjury for false statement.

ï¿½Willï¿½ means a formal document that provides for the distribution of the property of a decedent upon the death of the decedent. The term includes a codicil and a testamentary instrument that merely appoints an executor, revokes or revises another will, nominates a guardian, or expressly excludes or limits the right of an individual or class to succeed to property of the decedent passing by intestate succession.

For the purposes of this title, being ï¿½in the presenceï¿½ of a testator, settlor, principal or witness includes, without limitation, being in the same location at the same time or appearing in the same location at the same time by means of audio-video communication. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½audio-video communicationï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it in paragraph
of subsection 3 ofNRS 133.088.
As used in this title, unless the context otherwise requires, when the term ï¿½writingï¿½ or ï¿½writtenï¿½ is used in reference to a will, the term includes an electronic will.

section.heading: Circumstances in which person is interested person.

content.p: For the purposes of this title, a person is an interested person with respect to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A judicial proceeding, a notice of a proposed action or a nonjudicial settlement, if the person has or claims to have an enforceable right or interest that may be materially affected by the outcome of that proceeding, proposed action or nonjudicial settlement. While living, a settlor or a testator shall be deemed to have an enforceable right with respect to any trust or will that he or she created. For the purposes of this paragraph, a person may not claim to have a right or interest under an estate or trust after the entry of an order of the court declaring the right or interest invalid. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An estate of a decedent, if the person: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Has a property right in or claim against the estate of a decedent, including, without limitation, the Director of the Department of Health and Human Services in any case in which money is owed to the Department of Health and Human Services as a result of the payment of benefits for Medicaid; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Has priority for appointment as a personal representative; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is any other fiduciary representing an interested person. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A trust, if the person: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is a living settlor or, if a court has appointed a guardian of the estate of the settlor, the guardian of the estate appointed by the court; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Holds a presently exercisable power of appointment that permits the holder to designate or change the designation of a current beneficiary or a remainder beneficiary of that trust; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Holds a presently exercisable power that permits the holder to designate, remove or otherwise change the designation of a person who, pursuant to this paragraph, would be an interested person; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Is a creditor of the settlor who has a claim which has been accepted by the trustee or who has asserted the trusteeï¿½s liability therefor in a probate proceeding or in a civil action under subsection 8 or 9 ofNRS 111.779; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is a creditor of the trust who has given the trustee written notice of its claim. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A revocable trust that is the subject of a petition underNRS 164.015relating to the validity of the trust or any trust-related document, if the person, after the death of the settlor, under the terms of any version of the trust documents in dispute, would be: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A current beneficiary or a remainder beneficiary of that trust; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A trustee or a successor trustee, including, without limitation, a cotrustee. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A will that, while the testator is still living, is the subject of a petition under subsection 2 ofNRS 30.040, if the person, after the death of the testator, would be: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A beneficiary of that will; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A fiduciary designated in or pursuant to the terms of that will. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For the purposes of this title, the following persons are not interested persons: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
With respect to a motion, petition or proceeding, any person holding or claiming an interest or right that is not affected by the motion, petition or proceeding. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Director of the Department of Health and Human Services after any money owed to the Department has been paid in full or with respect to the estate or trust of a decedent who did not receive any benefits from Medicaid. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A vexatious litigant with regard to a motion, petition or proceeding for which the vexatious litigant has been denied standing pursuant toNRS 155.165. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As to the estate of a decedent: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
After a will has been admitted to probate, an heir, child or spouse who is not a beneficiary of the will, except for the purposes ofNRS 133.110,133.160and137.080. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A creditor whose claim has not been accepted by the personal representative, if the enforcement of the claim of the creditor is barred under the provisions ofchapter 11or147of NRS or any other applicable statute of limitations. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As to a trust: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The guardian of the person of an interested person, unless the guardian is expressly permitted to act for the interested person under the terms of the trust instrument; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A beneficiary or creditor whose right or claim is barred by any applicable statute of limitations, including, without limitation, the statute of limitations found inchapter 11of NRS orNRS 164.021,164.025or166.170; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any beneficiary of a revocable trust, except as expressly provided in paragraph
of subsection 1; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any disclaimant as to a disclaimed interest, except with respect to the enforcement of the disclaimer. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Current beneficiaryï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 165.020. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Remainder beneficiaryï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 165.020.
